commit_message:
[OVN] Add ``ProviderResourceAssociation`` to any ML2/OVN router

Since [1], any Neutron router created with ML2/OVN will have an
associated ``ProviderResourceAssociation`` register. The routers
created before this feature won't have any and it won't be possible
to delete them. This patch adds a temporary maintenance task to
create the needed register for these Neutron routers.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/883988

Closes-Bug: #2053122
Related-Bug: #2020823
Change-Id: Iecd5c7a66b16e25e9888dbd1e305586b2be2011e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/86/908986/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.objects import servicetype as servicetype_obj # TODO(ralonsoh): Remove this method in the C+2 cycle (next SLURP release) @has_lock_periodic(spacing=600, run_immediately=True) def add_provider_resource_association_to_routers(self): """Add the ``ProviderResourceAssociation`` register to all routers""" provider_name = 'ovn' context = n_context.get_admin_context() pra_list = servicetype_obj.ProviderResourceAssociation.get_objects( context, provider_name=provider_name) pra_res_ids = set(pra.resource_id for pra in pra_list) with db_api.CONTEXT_WRITER.using(context): for lr in self._nb_idl.lr_list().execute(check_error=True): router_id = lr.name.replace('neutron-', '') if router_id not in pra_res_ids: servicetype_obj.ProviderResourceAssociation( context, provider_name=provider_name, resource_id=router_id).create() raise periodics.NeverAgain()

commit_message:
Add FT for External OAuth2.0 Server Support

The test scenario has been added to verify the external OAuth 2.0
authentication function.

Implements: blueprint enhance-oauth2-interoperability
Change-Id: Ib158d3e4811c504fa7b9f18e866643f1da6dd946
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican-tempest-plugin refs/changes/24/903424/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (C) 2023 Fujitsu # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import json import jwt.utils import requests import time import uuid from barbican_tempest_plugin.services.key_manager.json import SecretClient class ExtOAuth2BaseClient(object): """Construct an Http Client to access the REST API.""" def __init__(self, http_schema, host, port, ca_cert=None, key_file=None, pem_file=None, ext_oauth2_auth=None, oauth2_access_token=None): self.http_schema = http_schema self.host = host self.port = port self.verify = ca_cert self.cert = None if key_file and pem_file: self.cert = (pem_file, key_file) self.ext_oauth2_auth = ext_oauth2_auth self.oauth2_access_token = oauth2_access_token self.base_pre_url = f'{http_schema}://{host}:{port}' def get_full_url(self, rel_path): """Get the full url for the REST API base on the relative path.""" if rel_path.startswith('/'): return f'{self.base_pre_url}{rel_path}' return f'{self.base_pre_url}/{rel_path}' @classmethod def decode_body(cls, resp): """Convert the resp to a dict object, if the content type is json.""" if resp.status_code == 204: # no content return content_type = resp.headers.get('Content-Type', '') if 'zip' in content_type: return resp.content if 'text' in content_type: return resp.text if 'json' in content_type and resp.text: return json.loads(resp.text) return resp.text def do_request(self, method, url, **kwargs): """Send an HTTP request.""" content_type = kwargs.pop('content_type', 'application/json') accept = kwargs.pop('accept', 'application/json') content_encoding = kwargs.pop('content_encoding', None) version = kwargs.pop('version', None) expected_status = kwargs.pop('expected_status', None) headers = kwargs.pop('headers', None) if not headers: headers = {} headers.setdefault('Content-Type', content_type) headers.setdefault('Accept', accept) if content_encoding: headers.setdefault('Content-Encoding', content_encoding) if version: headers.setdefault('Version', version) if self.oauth2_access_token: headers.setdefault('Authorization', f'Bearer {self.oauth2_access_token}') elif self.ext_oauth2_auth: headers.update(self.ext_oauth2_auth.get_headers()) body = kwargs.pop('body', None) if isinstance(body, dict): body = json.dumps(body) if method.upper() == 'POST': resp = requests.post(url, data=body, headers=headers, verify=self.verify, cert=self.cert) elif method.upper() == 'PUT': resp = requests.put(url, data=body, headers=headers, verify=self.verify, cert=self.cert) elif method.upper() == 'PATCH': resp = requests.patch(url, data=body, headers=headers, verify=self.verify, cert=self.cert) elif method.upper() == 'DELETE': resp = requests.delete(url, headers=headers, verify=self.verify, cert=self.cert) else: resp = requests.get(url, headers=headers, verify=self.verify, cert=self.cert) assert_msg = (f'The expected status is {expected_status}, ' f'but the actual status is {resp.status_code}. ' f'The response text: {resp.text}') if expected_status: if isinstance(expected_status, list): assert resp.status_code in expected_status, assert_msg else: assert resp.status_code == expected_status, assert_msg resp.status = resp.status_code return resp, resp.text def post(self, url, body, **kwargs): """Send a post HTTP request.""" return self.do_request('POST', url, body=body, **kwargs) def get(self, url, **kwargs): """Send a get HTTP request.""" return self.do_request('GET', url, **kwargs) def put(self, url, body, **kwargs): """Send a put HTTP request.""" return self.do_request('PUT', url, body=body, **kwargs) def delete(self, url, **kwargs): """Send a delete HTTP request.""" return self.do_request('DELETE', url, **kwargs) def patch(self, url, body, **kwargs): """Send a patch HTTP request.""" return self.do_request('PATCH', url, body=body, **kwargs) class ExtOAuth2KeycloakClient(ExtOAuth2BaseClient): """Construct an Http Client to access the Keycloak APIs.""" def __init__(self, http_schema, host, port, ca_cert=None, key_file=None, pem_file=None, admin_user_name=None, admin_password=None): super(ExtOAuth2KeycloakClient, self).__init__( http_schema, host, port, ca_cert=ca_cert, key_file=key_file, pem_file=pem_file) self.admin_user_name = admin_user_name self.admin_password = admin_password def do_request(self, method, url, context=None, expected_status=None, **kwargs): """Send an HTTP request.""" self.oauth2_access_token = self.get_admin_token() resp, body = super(ExtOAuth2KeycloakClient, self).do_request( method=method, url=url, expected_status=expected_status, **kwargs) resp_body = self.decode_body(resp) return resp, resp_body def get_admin_token(self): """Get access token for the admin user.""" path = '/realms/master/protocol/openid-connect/token' body = { 'client_id': 'admin-cli', 'username': self.admin_user_name, 'password': self.admin_password, 'grant_type': 'password' } resp = requests.post(url=self.get_full_url(path), data=body, verify=self.verify) assert_msg = ('The expected code is 200, ' f'but the actual code is {resp.status_code}. ' f'The response text: {resp.text}') assert resp.status_code == 200, assert_msg return json.loads(resp.text).get('access_token') def create_realm(self, name, ssl_required): """Create a realm.""" path = '/admin/realms' body = { 'realm': name, 'notBefore': 0, 'enabled': True, 'sslRequired': ssl_required, 'bruteForceProtected': False, 'eventsEnabled': False, 'failureFactor': 10 } _, resp_body = self.post(url=self.get_full_url(path), body=body, expected_status=201) return resp_body def delete_realm(self, name): """Delete a realm.""" path = f'/admin/realms/{name}' _, resp_body = self.delete(url=self.get_full_url(path), expected_status=204) return resp_body def create_client_scope(self, realm_name, client_scope_name, role_token_key=None, roles=None, other_mappers=None): """Create a client scope that includes roles and scopes information.""" path = f'/admin/realms/{realm_name}/client-scopes' body = { 'name': client_scope_name, 'protocol': 'openid-connect', 'attributes': { 'include.in.token.scope': 'true', 'display.on.consent.screen': 'true' }, 'protocolMappers': [] } if role_token_key and roles: body['protocolMappers'].append({ 'name': role_token_key, other_mappers=other_mappers) def create_domain_client_scope(self, realm_name, client_scope_name, scope_token_key=None, domain_id=None, domain_name=None, role_token_key=None, roles=None): """Create a 'exclude.session.state.from.auth.response': 'false', 'saml.artifact.binding': 'false', 'saml_force_name_id_format': 'false', 'acr.loa.map': '{}', 'tls.client.certificate.bound.access.tokens': inc_thumbprint, 'saml.authnstatement': 'false', 'display.on.consent.screen': 'false', 'x509.allow.regex.pattern.comparison': 'true', 'token.response.type.bearer.lower-case': 'false', 'saml.onetimeuse.condition': 'false' }, 'authenticationFlowBindingOverrides': {}, 'fullScopeAllowed': True, 'nodeReRegistrationTimeout': -1, 'access': { 'view': True, 'configure': True, 'manage': True } } if secret: body['secret'] = secret if attributes: for item in attributes: body['attributes'][item['key']] = item['value'] _, resp_body = self.post(url=self.get_full_url(path), body=body, expected_status=201) return resp_body def create_client_tls_client_auth(self, realm_name, client_id, is_bind_thumbprint): """Create a tls_client_auth client credentials.""" return 'token.endpoint.auth.signing.alg', 'value': jwt_algorithm}], ) def create_client_private_key_jwt(self, realm_name, client_id, is_bind_thumbprint, pem_file, jwt_algorithm='RS256'): """Create a secret=secret, is_bind_thumbprint=is_bind_thumbprint) def create_client_client_secret_post(self, realm_name, client_id, secret, is_bind_thumbprint): """Create a client_secret_post client expected_status=200) return resp_body def set_client_user_attribute(self, realm_name, user_id, user_domain_key, user_domain_id, user_domain_name, other_attributes=None): """Add the user domain information.""" user_info = self.get_client_user_info( realm_name=realm_name, user_id=user_id) path = f'/admin/realms/{realm_name}/users/{user_id}' user_domain_info = { 'id': user_domain_id, 'name': other_attributes.items(): user_info['attributes'][key] = val _, resp_body = self.put(url=self.get_full_url(path), body=user_info, expected_status=204) return resp_body def set_client_user_mapper(self, self.get(url=self.get_full_url(path), expected_status=200) return resp_body def query_client_scope_id(self, realm_name, client_scope_name): """Get the client scope id by the client scope name.""" path = f'/admin/realms/{realm_name}/client-scopes' _, resp_body = self.get(url=self.get_full_url(path), expected_status=200) client_scope_list = resp_body if len(client_scope_list) > 0: for item in (f'/admin/realms/{realm_name}/clients/{client_uuid}/' f'optional-client-scopes/{client_scope_id}') _, resp_body = self.put(url=self.get_full_url(path), body=None, expected_status=204) return resp_body class ExtOAuth2BarbicanClient(ExtOAuth2BaseClient, SecretClient): """Construct an Http Client to access the barbican APIs.""" def __init__(self, http_schema, host, port, ca_cert=None, key_file=None, pem_file=None, ext_oauth2_auth=None): super(ExtOAuth2BarbicanClient, self).__init__( http_schema, host, port, ca_cert=ca_cert, key_file=key_file, pem_file=pem_file, ext_oauth2_auth=ext_oauth2_auth) SecretClient.__init__(self, auth_provider=None) def request(self, method, url, **kwargs): """Send an HTTP request.""" if url.startswith('/'): url = f'/key-manager{url}' else: url = f'/key-manager/{url}' return super(ExtOAuth2BarbicanClient, self).do_request( method=method, url=self.get_full_url(url), **kwargs) def post(self, url, body, **kwargs): """Send a post HTTP request.""" return self.request('POST', url, body=body, **kwargs) def get(self, url, **kwargs): """Send a get HTTP request.""" return self.request('GET', url, **kwargs) def put(self, url, body, **kwargs): """Send a put HTTP request.""" return self.request('PUT', url, body=body, **kwargs) def delete(self, url, **kwargs): """Send a delete HTTP request.""" return self.request('DELETE', url, **kwargs) def patch(self, url, body, **kwargs): """Send a patch HTTP request.""" return self.request('PATCH', url, body=body, **kwargs) class ExtOAuth2Auth(object): """Construct an Auth to fetch an access token for HTTP access.""" def __init__(self, token_endpoint, auth_method, client_id, scope, ca_cert=None, key_file=None, pem_file=None, audience=None, client_secret=None, jwt_algorithm=None, jwt_bearer_time_out=None, jwt_key_file=None): self.token_endpoint = token_endpoint self.auth_method = auth_method self.client_id = client_id self.audience = audience self.client_secret = client_secret self.scope = scope self.verify = ca_cert self.cert = None self.key_file = key_file self.pem_file = pem_file if key_file and pem_file: self.cert = (pem_file, key_file) self.jwt_algorithm = jwt_algorithm self.jwt_bearer_time_out = jwt_bearer_time_out self.jwt_key_file = jwt_key_file def _get_token_by_client_secret_basic(self): """Access the access token API. Access the access token API to get an access token by the auth method 'client_secret_basic'. """ para = { 'scope': self.scope, 'grant_type': 'client_credentials' } session = requests.Session() http_response = session.post( self.token_endpoint, data=para, auth=(self.client_id, self.client_secret), verify=self.verify, cert=self.cert) return http_response def _get_token_by_client_secret_post(self): """Access the access token API. Access the access token API to get an access token by the auth method 'client_secret_post'. """ para = { 'client_id': self.client_id, 'client_secret': self.client_secret, 'scope': self.scope, 'grant_type': 'client_credentials' } session = requests.Session() http_response = session.post( self.token_endpoint, data=para, verify=self.verify, cert=self.cert) return http_response def _get_token_by_tls_client_auth(self): """Access the access token API. Access the access token API to get an access token by the auth method 'tls_client_auth'. """ para = { 'client_id': self.client_id, 'scope': self.scope, 'grant_type': 'client_credentials' } session = requests.Session() http_response = session.post( self.token_endpoint, data=para, verify=self.verify, cert=self.cert) return http_response def _get_token_by_private_key_jwt(self): """Access the access token API. Access the access token API to get an access token by the auth method 'private_key_jwt'. """ jwt_key_file = self.jwt_key_file with open(jwt_key_file, 'r') as jwt_file: jwt_key = jwt_file.read() iat = round(time.time()) exp = iat + self.jwt_bearer_time_out alg = self.jwt_algorithm client_assertion = jwt.encode( payload={ 'jti': str(uuid.uuid4()), 'iat': str(iat), 'exp': str(exp), 'iss': self.client_id, 'sub': self.client_id, 'aud': self.audience}, headers={ 'typ': 'JWT', 'alg': alg}, key=jwt_key, algorithm=alg) para = { 'client_id': self.client_id, 'client_assertion_type': 'urn:ietf:params:oauth:client-assertion-type:jwt-bearer', 'client_assertion': client_assertion, 'scope': self.scope, 'grant_type': 'client_credentials' } session = requests.Session() http_response = session.post( self.token_endpoint, data=para, verify=self.verify, cert=self.cert) return http_response def _get_token_by_client_secret_jwt(self): """Access the access token API. Access the access token API to get an access token by the auth method 'client_secret_jwt'. """ iat = round(time.time()) exp = iat + self.jwt_bearer_time_out alg = self.jwt_algorithm client_secret = self.client_secret client_assertion = jwt.encode( payload={ 'jti': str(uuid.uuid4()), 'iat': str(iat), 'exp': str(exp), 'iss': self.client_id, 'sub': self.client_id, 'aud': self.audience}, headers={ 'typ': 'JWT', 'alg': alg}, key=client_secret, algorithm=alg) para = { 'client_id': self.client_id, 'client_secret': client_secret, 'client_assertion_type': 'urn:ietf:params:oauth:client-assertion-type:jwt-bearer', 'client_assertion': client_assertion, 'scope': self.scope, 'grant_type': 'client_credentials' } session = requests.Session() http_response = session.post( self.token_endpoint, data=para, verify=self.verify, cert=self.cert) return http_response def get_headers(self): """Get an access token and add to request header for HTTP access.""" try: if self.auth_method == 'tls_client_auth': http_response = self._get_token_by_tls_client_auth() elif self.auth_method == 'client_secret_post': http_response = self._get_token_by_client_secret_post() elif self.auth_method == 'private_key_jwt': http_response = self._get_token_by_private_key_jwt() elif self.auth_method == 'client_secret_jwt': http_response = self._get_token_by_client_secret_jwt() else: http_response = self._get_token_by_client_secret_basic() if http_response.status_code != 200: raise Exception( 'The OAuth2.0 access token API returns an incorrect ' f'response. response_status: {http_response.status_code}, ' f'response_text: {http_response.text}') access_token = http_response.json().get('access_token') if not access_token: raise Exception( f'Failed to get an access token: {http_response.text}') except Exception as error: raise Exception(f'Unable to get an access token: {error}') header = {'Authorization': f'Bearer {access_token}'} return header

subject: OVN: Use OVN for the grub CI job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-09-06 20:58:42.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/ironic-jobs.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/6c8b846de73b6f96298751b2c7e7b78b83c4c5a9', 'message': "OVN: Use OVN for the grub CI job

The underlying IP which can be used for the TFTP server address can
change between CI jobs, and if we're unluck enough to land on a 10/8
address with grub, sadness ensues because it is on the private network,
and we're not providing a private network tftp target with the OVN job
configuration.

So instead, just use the IP which br-ex should operate with which
allows normal routing to take place and Julia can regain her sanity.

Related-Bug: 2033430
Change-Id: I5d55da28cade0527dd7f00fb5380943ac7164b50
"}]
commit_message:
OVN: Use OVN for the grub CI job

The underlying IP which can be used for the TFTP server address can
change between CI jobs, and if we're unluck enough to land on a 10/8
address with grub, sadness ensues because it is on the private network,
and we're not providing a private network tftp target with the OVN job
configuration.

So instead, just use the IP which br-ex should operate with which
allows normal routing to take place and Julia can regain her sanity.

Related-Bug: 2033430
Change-Id: I5d55da28cade0527dd7f00fb5380943ac7164b50
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/81/893981/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Use a remote address, such as what br-ex gets, to avoid # conflicts based upon different addressing behavior. IRONIC_TFTPSERVER_IP: 172.24.5.1 Q_AGENT: ovn Q_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPE: vlan Q_ML2_PLUGIN_MECHANISM_DRIVERS: ovn ENABLE_CHASSIS_AS_GW: True ML2_L3_PLUGIN: "ovn-router,trunk" OVN_DBS_LOG_LEVEL: dbg OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE: True Q_BUILD_OVS_FROM_GIT: True # NOTE(TheJulia): Ubuntu ships an out of date OVN package, so # we need to build from source. These are the minimum versions # representing June 2023 release. Ubuntu Kinetic is shipping Q3 2022 # i.e. OVN 22.09, so likely possible to remove sometime *after* # Ubuntu Mantic OVN 2023.03. OVN_BRANCH: v23.06.0 OVS_BRANCH: v3.1.1 devstack_services: q-agt: False q-dhcp: False q-l3: False ovn-controller: True ovn-northd: True q-ovn-metadata-agent: True

commit_message:
Return proper number of pci devices for virtio

We cannot attach more than 26 volumes when using virtio driver.
Now, the compute will raise a correct 403 error in this situation
(instead of 500).

Change-Id: I0b9f4a44eb5ca1af59fdca7e239625ce34476374
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>

commit_message:
Clean state shelving* during nova-compute init

states:
- SHELVING
- SHELVING_IMAGE_PENDING_UPLOAD
- SHELVING_IMAGE_UPLOADING

This states are not managed during the nova-compute init. This
mistake impact the management of this instance, without reset state on
the instance no action can be taken and the instance never been shelve.

Change-Id: I642382f1f5bfe5ea86476174a8161faeb8a0d213
(cherry picked from commit 92e48aa146a3626806e375301922c707f0008555)

commit_message:
Clean state image_backup during nova-compute init

IMAGE_BACKUP state is not managed during the nova-compute init. This
mistake impact the management of this instance, without reset state on
the instance no action can be taken.

Change-Id: Idc1782def213a145fef3b0249abc0cc82d7d254e

commit_message:
Avoid setting instance in error during live-migration

Nova conductor was setting instance in error on MessagingTimeout
during precheck.
By catching the error, we will safely restore the instance to ACTIVE.

Change-Id: I7452712ff8ea0ac4e5ceeafc3316af543a89c00f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/68/907968/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except messaging.MessagingTimeout: msg = _("Timeout while check_can_live_migrate_source from %(src)s " "to host %(dest)s") % {'src': instance.host, 'dest': CONF.host} raise exception.MigrationPreCheckError(msg)

subject: Fix request_specs not updated after failed rebuild
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-02-06 09:22:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/85e045621c4ad8861ca5d44338af57d0b2591101', 'message': 'Fix request_specs not updated after failed rebuild

Request_specs is not updated during rebuild if we raise an execption
during the scheduling of the instance. we can found update of image_ref

the instance.

Change-Id: I217ad395fecabed3576bf690596af84d3c674054
'}]
commit_message:
Fix request_specs not updated after failed rebuild

Request_specs is not updated during rebuild if we raise an execption
during the scheduling of the instance. we can found update of image_ref
but request_specs missing so we added to not block the next action on
the instance.

Change-Id: I217ad395fecabed3576bf690596af84d3c674054
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/67/907967/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(plibeau): Rollback image_meta is required also # for next action on the instance (like: migration). image_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_image_ref( context, self.image_api, orig_image_ref) request_spec.image = image_meta request_spec.save()

commit_message:
Use Placement API along with the hypervisor stats

Hypervisor stats do not reflect accurate VCPUs and PCPUs usage, so
to have a correct picture we need to use Placement API along with
hypervisors.

We add VCPUs and PCPUs usage diagrams and Resource Provider tab
to display correct stats.

Since there is no python client for the Placement API, and the
OpenStack SDK doesn't support the endpoints we need, we call the
endpoints directly.

Related-Bug: #1974470
Related-Bug: #1397917

Change-Id: If41cea0edeec8c95717229eb017e32898417a891

subject: Figure out backend from URI
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-27 15:31:44.000000000', 'files': ['glance/location.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/39654d32abc9a90702ca23d809761aa873fb903f', 'message': 'Figure out backend from URI

Add a mechanism in _check_image_location to retrieve the backend from
URL if no backend provided in metadata.

This will avoid calling _check_location_uri with backend=None and fail
with an Invalid location.

We can endup in this situation when nova tries to PATCH an image by
adding a location (nova is not populating the metadata). See [1]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/image/glance.py#L559

Change-Id: I66be51f467fb9465fb479bdc823ade283a7ddaf9
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Figure out backend from URI

Add a mechanism in _check_image_location to retrieve the backend from
URL if no backend provided in metadata.

This will avoid calling _check_location_uri with backend=None and fail
with an Invalid location.

We can endup in this situation when nova tries to PATCH an image by
adding a location (nova is not populating the metadata). See [1]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/image/glance.py#L559

Change-Id: I66be51f467fb9465fb479bdc823ade283a7ddaf9
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/46/802546/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(amorin): if backend is not in metadata (e.g. request coming # from nova), then try to figure it out from URL if not backend: backend = store_utils._get_store_id_from_uri(location['url']) location['metadata']['backend'] = backend

subject: Extend configurable skippability of neutron calls to project instance detail
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-02-13 15:28:29.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/views.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/4de36bb649c514f50d2a958c9277097a08b23cec', 'message': 'Extend configurable skippability of neutron calls to project instance detail

The OPENSTACK_INSTANCE_RETRIEVE_IP_ADDRESSES config aids
in envs struggling to load the instance list due to having
too many ports or bad neutron plugin performance. However,
the config does not apply its effect to the instance detail
page, which cannot be loaded due to the neutron calls
taking too long.

This patch extends the config option to the instance
detail page, allowing the same benefit (and side-effects)
of the instance list page.

Related-bug: #2045168
Change-Id: I3e71a208a1c7212e168d63a259f2adddf27dbabf
(cherry picked from commit 95089025fda7c8cce6f7195e2a63f7f09efc9e0a)
'}]
commit_message:
Extend configurable skippability of neutron calls to project instance detail

The OPENSTACK_INSTANCE_RETRIEVE_IP_ADDRESSES config aids
in envs struggling to load the instance list due to having
too many ports or bad neutron plugin performance. However,
the config does not apply its effect to the instance detail
page, which cannot be loaded due to the neutron calls
taking too long.

This patch extends the config option to the instance
detail page, allowing the same benefit (and side-effects)
of the instance list page.

Related-bug: #2045168
Change-Id: I3e71a208a1c7212e168d63a259f2adddf27dbabf
(cherry picked from commit 95089025fda7c8cce6f7195e2a63f7f09efc9e0a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/10/908910/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not settings.OPENSTACK_INSTANCE_RETRIEVE_IP_ADDRESSES: return

subject: Fix a typo in pxe_redfish definition
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-02-14 12:34:49.000000000', 'files': ['vars/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ironic/commit/ca92499dda78d5a37cde36e707b0adde4dfea311', 'message': 'Fix a typo in pxe_redfish definition

commit_message:
Fix a typo in pxe_redfish definition

This typo leads for drivers misconfiguration and being unable to register
redfish as a proper driver.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/+/907180
